documentType: last will and testament with codicil
summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, dated October 24, 2012, with a first codicil dated June 6, 2013. It appoints executors, directs all estate assets to be transferred to The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2012 Trust, and includes detailed provisions for estate administration. The codicil changes the successor executor.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The creator of the will, directing the disposition of his estate upon his death. He is identified as residing on Little St. James Island.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Appointed as one of the primary executors of Epstein's will in both the original document and the codicil.

persons.name: Joseph Pagano
persons.context: Appointed as one of the primary executors of Epstein's will in both the original document and the codicil.

persons.name: James E. Staley
persons.context: Appointed as one of the primary executors of Epstein's will in both the original document and the codicil.

persons.name: Andrew Farkas
persons.context: Named as the successor executor in the original will if any of the primary executors fail to qualify or cease to act.

persons.name: David J. Mitchell
persons.context: Replaces Andrew Farkas as the named successor executor in the first codicil to the will.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: One of the witnesses to the execution of the first codicil to the will on June 6, 2013.

persons.name: Lesley Groff
persons.context: One of the witnesses to the execution of the first codicil to the will on June 6, 2013.

connections.description: Epstein appoints Indyke as an executor of his estate, indicating a relationship of significant trust and responsibility.
Epstein appoints Pagano as an executor of his estate, indicating a relationship of significant trust and responsibility.
Epstein appoints Staley as an executor of his estate, indicating a relationship of significant trust and responsibility.
Both are appointed as co-executors of Epstein's estate, tasked with jointly administering the will.
Both are appointed as co-executors of Epstein's estate, tasked with jointly administering the will.
Epstein names Mitchell as the successor executor in the codicil, replacing Andrew Farkas from the original will.

events.title: Execution of Last Will and Testament
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein signs his last will and testament, appointing executors and directing his estate to a trust.

events.title: Execution of First Codicil
events.description: Epstein signs a first codicil to his will, changing the named successor executor from Andrew Farkas to David J. Mitchell.

locations: Little St. James Island, St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
State of New York, County of New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's will directs that his entire estate, after payments for debts and expenses, be transferred to 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2012 Trust' dated October 24, 2012.
The will appoints Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and James E. Staley as co-executors, each to receive $250,000 upon completion of probate.
A first codicil, executed on June 6, 2013, changes the named successor executor from Andrew Farkas to David J. Mitchell.
The will includes a 'no-contest' clause, disinheriting any beneficiary who challenges the will or the trust.
The document grants the executors extremely broad powers to manage, invest, and dispose of estate assets without needing court approval.
